title: 3 Deputies Arrested For Murder in Jail Death
content:
Next on Patch » Have a Child in College? Don't Miss These Tax Deductions 3 Deputies Arrested For Murder in Jail Death The victim was found unresponsive in his cell on Aug. 27. By Bea Karnes (Patch Staff) September 3, 2015 ShareTweetGoogle PlusRedditEmailComments0 Three deputies were arrested today on suspicion of the murder of an inmate in Santa Clara County Jail in San Jose last week, a sheriff’s spokesman said. The deputies were arrested in the death of a 31-year-old man who was an inmate at the jail, sheriff’s Sgt. James Jensen said. Also See: Join Coastal Clean-Up Day: Los Gatos Creek Effort Needs Volunteers
The inmate, who has not been identified, was found unresponsive around 12:30 a.m. on Aug. 27 during a routine welfare check, sheriff’s Sgt. James Jensen said. More from Los Gatos Patch Teen From Area School Among Top 10 Finalists In National Science ChallengeHave a Child in College? Don't Miss These Tax DeductionsIs Your Gardener A Green Gardener? Welfare checks are done hourly or every 30 minutes depending on the area of the jail. Emergency crews administered first aid to the inmate, who was pronounced dead at the scene, Jensen said. Also See: Man Shot At South Bay Nightclub Sues Singer Chris Brown
The deputies were placed on administrative leave last week, according to Jensen. The sheriff’s office has not released the names of the deputies or the circumstances surrounding the death.
